title: What is value of x if 2x (2x-1) - (2x+1) (2x-1) = 0? - Quora

response.answer_text: Notice, expand the second term by multiplication, [math]2x(2x-1)-(2x+1)(2x-1)=0[/math] [math]\underline{2x(2x-1)}-\underline{2x(2x-1)}-(2x-1)=0[/math] [math]-(2x-1)=0[/math] [math]2x-1=0[/math] [math]2x=1[/math] [math]x=1/2=0.5[/math]

2x (2x - 1) - (2x + 1) (2x - 1) = 0, 2x (2x - 1) - {(2x)² - 1²} = 0, {(2x +1) (2x -1) = (2x)² - 1²} 2x (2x - 1) - ( 4x² - 1) = 0. Opening all brackets- 4x² - 2x - 4x² + 1 = 0, -2x + 1 = 0, {4x² - 4x² = 0} -2x = -1, {Minus signs will be canceled of both sides} x = 1/2.
